info.interactivesystems.gamificationengine.api

Class RuleApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.interactivesystems.gamificationengine.api.RuleApi

  • @Path(value="/rule")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public class RuleApi
extends Object
    With a Goalrule can be defined which tasks and if all or only one task have to be fulfilled to reach a goal. When a goal rule is fulfilled the goal is added to the playerâ€™s list of finished goals. If the goal can also be done by a group it is also added to its list of finished goals. There are two types of rules that can be defined: a TaskRule or a PointsRule. All created rules which are created in the context of one specific organisation can be requested with the appendant API key. With the given id also a particular rule can be requested, also for example to change some attributes like the name, the description or, if it is a PointsRule, the amount of points which has to be reached.

    • Method Detail

      • createNewTaskRule

        @POST
 @Path(value="/task")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createNewTaskRule(@QueryParam(value="type") @NotNull
                                                                                 String type,
                                                                                 @QueryParam(value="name") @NotNull
                                                                                 String name,
                                                                                 @QueryParam(value="description")
                                                                                 String description,
                                                                                 @QueryParam(value="tasks") @NotNull @ValidListOfDigits
                                                                                 String taskIds,
                                                                                 @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                 String apiKey)
        Creates a new task rule. By the creation the type of rule (DoAllTasksRule or DoAnyTaskRule) has to be defined, the rule's name, description and the ids which should be associated with this rule. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the task rule, this can be "DoAllTasksRule" or "DoAnyTaskRule". This field must not be null.
        name - The name of the task rule. This parameter is required.
        description - Optionally the description of the rule can be passed. This can help the player to understand which tasks she/he to fulfil.
        taskIds - The list of task ids that are have to be respective can be fulfilled to complete the goal. These ids are separated by commas.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this rule belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of DoAllTasksRule or DoAnyTaskRule in JSON.

      • createNewPointRule

        @POST
 @Path(value="/point")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createNewPointRule(@QueryParam(value="name") @NotNull
                                                                                   String name,
                                                                                   @QueryParam(value="description")
                                                                                   String description,
                                                                                   @QueryParam(value="points") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                                   String points,
                                                                                   @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                   String apiKey)
        Creates a new points rule. By the creation the amount of points which has to be reached to fulfil the goal and also its name are needed. A description can also be made. If a goal is associated with a points rule and is also repeatable the goal will be added once only to the player's or respectively group's list of already finished goals. The rewards of such a goal are also awarded only once. So a points rule can be fulfilled once only although the associated goal is repeatable. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the task rule. This parameter is required.
        description - Optionally the description of the rule can be passed. This can help the player to understand which tasks she/he to fulfil.
        points - The amount of points which should be reached.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this rule belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of GetPointsRule in JSON.

      • getRules

        @GET
 @Path(value="/*")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getRules(@QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                    String apiKey)
        This method collects all available rules associated with the given API key and so all goal rules which belong to the associated organisation. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this rule belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response as List of GoalRules in JSON.

      • getRule

        @GET
 @Path(value="/{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getRule(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                      String id,
                                                                      @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                      String apiKey)
        This method gets one specific goal rule which is identified by the given id and the API key. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - Required integer as path parameter which uniquely identify the goal rule.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this rule belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of GoalRule in JSON.

      • deleteRule

        @DELETE
 @Path(value="{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteRule(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                           String id,
                                                                           @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                           String apiKey)
        Removes a specific goal rule from the data base which is identified by the given id and the API key. But only if the goal rule is not associated to a goal. Then first the goal has to deleted. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - Required integer as path parameter which uniquely identify the goal rule.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this rule belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of GoalRule in JSON.

      • changeRuleAttributes

        @PUT
 @Path(value="/{id}/attributes")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response changeRuleAttributes(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                                              String id,
                                                                                              @QueryParam(value="attribute") @NotNull
                                                                                              String attribute,
                                                                                              @QueryParam(value="value") @NotNull
                                                                                              String value,
                                                                                              @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                              String apiKey)
        With this method the fields of one specific goal rule can be changed. For this the goal rule id, the API key of the specific organisation, the name of the field and the new field's value are needed. To modify the name or description of the goal rule the new string has to be passed with the attribute field. If the If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the goal rule that should be changed. This parameter is required.
        attribute - The name of the attribute which should be modified. This parameter is required. The following names of attributes can be used to change the associated field: "description" and "name". The tasks that have to be completed or the amount of points that have to be reached, can't be changed later.
        value - The new value of the attribute. This parameter is required.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this goal rule belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of GoalRule in JSON.
